creditline: Gift of Carol and Jeffrey Horvitz
description: ridged sculpture in marbled blue, cream and green that has one side that is domed and comes to a point and one side that is flat that has a hole at the center and makes the piece vessel-like; piece sits upright on the one slightly flat side on the ridged, rounded edge
text: Ogata Kamio is a self-taught artist specializing in the optically stunning but extremely arduous art of marbleized clay (neriage). Hundreds of paper-thin layers of colored clay are thrown together, creating a single vessel with distinct, striated patterns. In this case, he then carved the surface and created ridges.
title: Lunar Landing
